latest_revision.text:
==Overview==
The jewelry station is geared towards metal work, but fortunately you can use a lot of tools to make all kinds of things in the lab and come to the jewelry station to add jump rings and connect fun pieces together.

You can also follow some of the Jewelry Station happenings on the [https://www.facebook.com/groups/443731491076052/ facebook group].

==Tools==
*dapping set
*disc cutter
*jewelers saws
*bench pins
*planishing hammers
*texture hammers
*needle files
*storage box
*parallel pliers
*flat and round nose pliers
*flush cutters
*oxyacetylene torch
*[https://americanlaboratorytrading.com/lab-equipment-products/branson-b3200r-1-ultrasonic-cleaner_8951 Branson B3200 Ultrasonic Cleaner], [https://www.proequip.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Bransonic_manual_1200-2200-3200-5200-8200.pdf manual]
*Polishing wheel (DO NOT USE! See station champion)
*bench blocks
*ball pein hammers
*metal stamps (letter and other designs)
*shitty knock off Dremels and some bits

==Supplies==
Generally bring your own supplies
*sand paper
*jewelry saw blades
*sharpies
*cut lube

==Classes==
Some of the past classes that have been hosted;
*Silversmithing 101 - Make A Ring
*[https://guestlist.co/events/749361 Jewelry Basics: A Riveted Pendant]
*[https://guestlist.co/events/751854 Jewelry Basics: Hammered Wire Jewelry]
*[https://guestlist.co/events/749352 Jewelry Basics: Intro to working with wire]
*[https://guestlist.co/events/749343 Jewelry Basics: Working with Wire Part 2]
*[https://guestlist.co/events/749379 Jewelry Basics: Disc-cutting and Doming]
*[https://guestlist.co/events/749334 Jewelry Basics: Bead Loom Bracelets]

[[Category:Jewelry]]
